author: draganrakita
content:
I wanted to leave a few words as reth/revm is the newest client that is adding EOF and i will not be present in tomorrows ACDE. It took me around two months to be close in pairs with Besu and evmone. It still needs integration with Reth, but that is a smaller task. So I would say that the effort of adding EOF is around three to three and a half months for one person (depending on the client). Work outside of EVM is in adding the first EOF contract and a new transaction type.Â 

Instructions were straightforward to add, and they did not clash with legacy opcodes. EOF verification was a different thing, and I depended more on code than spec, but it has good tests. Instruction testing is still missing but it is currently worked on.
